body:
Hi Peter, 

This definitely sounds quite strange. There should be not have been a performance impact compared to the old version. If anything it should have gotten better. I will investigate and update the thread. When you say `lots of files of this zip`, how many files are approximately in the zip file?

Hi Srikanth,
thanks again for your quick reply. 
The zip file contains 28479 files in two folders.
Regards, Peter
And what was the total size of the zip file?
985 MB

To reproduce this issue, I tested with this scenario: 

~ 900MB zip file (unencrypted) containing 28479 files all in a single folder, and each file of uncompressed (before zipping) size ~ 35kb.

I tested on a mac. To extract the file, it took ~ 27 seconds with v2.2.6 and took ~ 19 seconds with v1.3.2. Although it is not a 10x difference that you have seen, it is still a considerable difference, and I presume the difference between your and my results are because of hardware configuration, and probably also the OS. 

I think I know the reason for this behaviour. I did a fix. After that v2.2.7-SNAPSHOT takes ~ 20 seconds, which is pretty much close to the v1.3.2. Can you please try with v2.2.7-SNAPSHOT? I would like to see the results from your side as well before I do further investigations.

If you have trouble accessing this snapshot version with your default maven settings, add the following to your `distributionManagement`:

```
<distributionManagement>
    <snapshotRepository>
        <id>ossrh</id>
        <url>https://oss.sonatype.org/content/repositories/snapshots</url>
    </snapshotRepository>
</distributionManagement>
```

Hi Srikanth,
sounds good, but unfortunately I cannot acces v2.2.7-SNAPSHOT, even with the settings in the distributionManagement. Did you push? I can't see any commit the last days.
Regards, Peter

Hi Peter,

That is strange. You can see the [snapshot here](https://oss.sonatype.org/content/repositories/snapshots/net/lingala/zip4j/zip4j/2.2.7-SNAPSHOT/). I pushed it from my local machine and not from github. I did the same process in the past and users were able to get it (with other versions though). Where did you configure that `snapshotRepository`? In your pom or in your maven settings?
BTW, it is probably obvious, but just to be clear, the version is `2.2.7-SNAPSHOT` and not with the "v" in front.

Hi, yes I did not use the "v" ðŸ˜‰. I had a conflict due to my configuration in settings.xml, now I was able to build the application with your snapshot. I'll do a test soon and keep you informed. Thanks a lot, Peter

Hi Srikanth,
sorry for the late reply, but the tests took a while.
2.2.7-SNAPSHOT is faster, but still far awar from 1.3.2.
The time is now down from 330 minutes to ~229 minutes.

I enriched the code with log messages and attached both logs, 1.3.2 and 2.2.7. 
Obviously "getFileHeader" needs a lot more time:
File: {89863fc2-3306-11dd-bd11-0800200c9a66}.json (size: 148KB)
getFileHeader 1.3.2:        3 ms 
getFileHeader 2.2.7:  1168 ms

Thanks and regards, Peter
[zip4j-1.3.2.zip](https://github.com/srikanth-lingala/zip4j/files/3909958/zip4j-1.3.2.zip)
[zip4j-2.2.7.zip](https://github.com/srikanth-lingala/zip4j/files/3909959/zip4j-2.2.7.zip)
Thanks for the info Peter. I will have a look into it and update the thread.

Hi Peter,

Thanks again for the logs. This has greatly helped me in my investigation. I was looking at the wrong place all the while, but the logs helped me find the issue. I think this version should have much better performance. Can you please try with `2.2.7.1-SNAPSHOT` and let me know the results?

Thanks
Srikanth

Hi Srikanth,
great job, it is incredibly fast again, as fast as 1.3.2!
But...  
AES-256 decryption does not work any more with 2.2.7.1-SNAPSHOT, with 2.2.7-SNAPSHOT ist worked. ðŸ˜‰ 

Thanks, Peter
@markgbrown Yes, that was the fix I did in the snapshot which worked. And also, I increased the buffer size from 512 bytes to 4kb, which will result in less i/o ops (it was 4kb in v1.3.2 as well).

Hi Srikanth,  
I have to apologize. I mixed up my two differnt version on the machine. AES works fine with 2.2.7.1
I'm currently running the performance test again. 

Sorry for the the confusion I've caused.

Regards, Peter

Hi Srikanth,
as promised my test result:
2.2.7.1 is comparable fast as 1.3.2
The unencrypted zip is now down from ~225 min (2.2.7) to ~2,5 min (2.2.7.1). 
1.3.2 did it in ~2,25 min, but this can be normal fluctuations regarding the machine load.
And AES works (!!), of course it slows down a bit, but with 5,75 min still very good.
Thank you very much for your great support! 

Regards, Peter
v2.2.7 released with the fix. It might take a few hours until the artefact is synced to maven central.

> Thank you very much for your great support!

No problem Peter. Thank you for your support as well. Let me know if you have any further feedback or face any further issues with zip4j.

Regards
Srikanth
